XRViewerPoseViews.summary:
The read-only property views
returns an array which contains every which must be rendered in
order to fully represent the scene from the viewpoint defined by the viewer pose. For
monoscopic devices, this array contains a single view.

blockquote.para:
Warning: There is no guarantee that the number of views will
remain constant over the lifetime of an . For each frame, you
should always use the current length of this array rather than caching the value.

remarks.para:
Stereo views require two views to render properly, with the left eye's view having its
set to the string left and the right eye's
view a value of right.

XRViewerPoseViews.value:
An array of objects, one for each view available as part of the
scene for the current viewer pose. This array's length may potentially vary over the
lifetime of the (for example, if the viewer enables or disables
stereo mode on their XR output device).
